page.title: 13Bowd Lane Wood
page.content: This wood has deciduous trees. They are mainly Ash, Hazel, Oak, Hawthorn and Elderberry. On the Eastern side of the wood is a Medieval bank. There are four main paths through the wood which are called rides. The rides divide the wood into quarters. There are 9 quarters in the wood. Rockingham Estates own the wood but it is looked after by Mr and Mrs. Champion of Park Farm. They also look after Walter Wood. Throughout the woods there are feeding shelters for pheasants and there is a wire enclosure for breeding them. When they are older the pheasants are released into the woods. Open spaces are cut to allow the birds to sun themselves. The Hazel trees are coppiced by the master thatchers of Rutland. The Hazel spars are used in thatched roofs of Northamptonshire, Leicestershire and Rutland.
